admin.managePresence: Manage your team's digital presence with powerful tools
admin.quickAccess: Quick access to all administrative functions

hero.title: Cyborg Cats
hero.subtitle: FRC Team 4256
hero.description: Building robots, building futures. From Westminster Christian Academy in St. Louis, Missouri.

intro.part1: From Westminster Christian Academy in the heart of St. Louis, Missouri, we are
intro.part2: representing the Gateway City while engineering the future through robotics with a mission to
intro.mission: serve God and impact our community
intro.part3: through STEM education and Christian values.

first.title: What is FIRST?
first.subtitle: Learn about FIRST Robotics and our impact in the community
first.description: FIRST (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) is a global robotics community that prepares young people for the future through team-based robot-building challenges, while we at Cyborg Cats integrate our Christian faith and values into everything we do.
first.quote: To transform our culture by creating a world where science and technology are celebrated and where young people dream of becoming science and technology leaders, while we strive to honor God in all we do.
first.founder: Dean Kamen, FIRST Founder (adapted with our Christian mission)
first.moreThanRobotsDesc: FIRST programs inspire students to pursue careers in STEM fields while developing leadership, teamwork, and problem-solving skills that extend far beyond the competition arena, all while we seek to glorify God through our work and witness.

features.designBuildDesc: Teams design, build, and program industrial-sized robots to compete in challenging game scenarios
features.collaborationDesc: Students work with adult mentors from engineering and technology companies
features.competitionDesc: Regional and world championship events bring teams together in exciting robot competitions
features.realWorldSkillsDesc: Develops engineering, programming, project management, and leadership abilities

impact.title: Our Impact
impact.subtitle: From our home base in St. Louis, Missouri, we are building more than robots—we are building a better future through STEM education, community outreach, and advocacy across the Gateway State and beyond,
impact.stemCompanionDesc: Connecting children with special needs to STEM education through innovative programs and dedicated outreach.
impact.womenInStemDesc: Our upper leadership is predominantly female, demonstrating our commitment to empowering women in technology.
impact.legislativeAdvocacyDesc: Working directly with legislators to advocate for STEM education policies that benefit students across Missouri.
impact.globalOutreachDesc: Expanding STEM opportunities internationally, helping establish FRC teams and programs in South Korea and Ethiopia.

community.title: Community
community.subtitle: Hear from our students and connect with our growing alumni network

sponsors.title: Our Partners
sponsors.subtitle: Building the Future Together
sponsors.description: We're grateful to our sponsors who make our mission possible. Through their support, we're able to compete, innovate, and inspire the next generation of STEM leaders.
sponsors.communityImpactDesc: Support STEM education and inspire the next generation of engineers and innovators
sponsors.brandVisibilityDesc: Get your logo on our robot, team apparel, and marketing materials at competitions
sponsors.talentPipelineDesc: Connect with motivated students who could be your future employees
sponsors.corporateResponsibilityDesc: Demonstrate your commitment to education and community development

media.title: Media
media.subtitle: Gallery
media.description: Explore our journey through stunning photography and stay connected on Instagram

photoGallery.title: Behind the Scenes
photoGallery.subtitle: Experience the energy and passion of our team through these captured moments

news.subtitle: News
news.description: Stay informed with our latest competition victories, community outreach programs, and groundbreaking STEM initiatives
news.noNews: No news posts yet. Check back soon!

newsletter.title: Join Our Newsletter
newsletter.subtitle: Stay up to date with our latest achievements, upcoming events, and behind-the-scenes content from the Cyborg Cats team
newsletter.competitionUpdatesDesc: Get notified about our latest competition results and achievements
newsletter.communityImpactDesc: Learn about our outreach programs and how you can get involved
newsletter.behindScenesDesc: Exclusive content about our robot development and team activities

resources.title: Resources & Learning
resources.subtitle: Tools for Growth
resources.description: Access tools, guides, and materials for robotics teams and STEM education

stemCompanion.title: Breaking Barriers in STEM Education
stemCompanion.subtitle: STEM Companion: 10+ Years of Making Robotics Accessible to All Students
stemCompanion.description: Founded by the Cyborg Cats in 2012, STEM Companion is our non-profit dedicated to including students with disabilities in STEM through hands-on robotics experiences.

demonstrations.title: Interactive Robotics Demonstrations
demonstrations.description: From Promise Academy to schools across St. Louis, we bring hands-on robotics experiences directly to students with disabilities

resources.title: Digital Resource Library
resources.description: Free activities, worksheets, and instructional materials for educators, families, and FIRST teams

movement.title: #BeACompanion Movement
movement.description: Inspiring FIRST teams nationwide to champion disability inclusion in their communities

stemCompanion.story: What started as a single demonstration at Promise Academy has grown into a comprehensive non-profit advocating for disability inclusion in STEM across our community and beyond.
